author: Vonng (rh@vonng.com)
description: PostgreSQL Catalog Explorer for Single Instance

panels.description: cls = ${cls}. Used as an unique cluster identifier and resource namespace.
panels.title: Cluster

panels.description: ins = ${ins}, used as unique instance identifier.
panels.title: Instance

panels.description: Instance identifier ${ins}
panels.title: Database

panels.description: Recovery status of this instance

targets.rawSql: SELECT pg_is_in_recovery()::INTEGER AS recovery

panels.title: Status

panels.description: Database OID of ${datname}

targets.rawSql: SELECT oid FROM pg_database WHERE datname = '$datname';

panels.title: OID

targets.rawSql: select system_identifier FROM pg_control_system();
select to_timestamp(((system_identifier>>32) & (2^32 -1)::bigint)) AS created FROM pg_control_system();

SELECT *
FROM (SELECT count(*) AS databases FROM pg_database) d,
     (SELECT count(*) AS roles FROM pg_roles) r,
     (SELECT count(*) AS tablespaces FROM pg_tablespace) tsp,
     (SELECT count(*) AS schemas FROM pg_namespace) nsp,
     (SELECT count(*) AS relations FROM pg_class WHERE relkind in ('r','m','p')) rc,
     (SELECT count(*) AS indexes FROM pg_class WHERE relkind = 'i') ic,
     (SELECT count(*) AS sequences FROM pg_class WHERE relkind = 'S') sc,
     (SELECT count(*) AS views FROM pg_class WHERE relkind = 'v') vc;
;

panels.description:
Databases of this instance
Tmpl: is this database a template?
Conn: is this database connectable?

targets.rawSql:
SELECT d.datname, d.oid, d.datconnlimit, d.datfrozenxid, age(d.datfrozenxid) AS age, datistemplate,datallowconn,  1 - (datistemplate)::INTEGER + 2 * d.datallowconn::INTEGER AS status, psd.numbackends AS sessions,
       pg_catalog.pg_get_userbyid(d.datdba) as owner, pg_catalog.pg_encoding_to_char(d.encoding) as encoding,
       d.datcollate, d.datctype,  pg_catalog.array_to_string(d.datacl, E'\n') AS acl,
       CASE WHEN pg_catalog.has_database_privilege(d.datname, 'CONNECT') THEN pg_catalog.pg_database_size(d.datname) ELSE -1 END AS size,
       t.spcname as tablespace,
       pg_catalog.shobj_description(d.oid, 'pg_database') as description
FROM pg_catalog.pg_database d JOIN pg_catalog.pg_tablespace t on d.dattablespace = t.oid JOIN pg_stat_database psd on d.oid = psd.datid
ORDER BY 1;

panels.description: Roles of this database

targets.rawSql:
SELECT r.oid, r.rolname, r.rolsuper, r.rolinherit,
       r.rolcreaterole, r.rolcreatedb, r.rolcanlogin,
       r.rolconnlimit, r.rolvaliduntil,
       ARRAY(SELECT b.rolname
             FROM pg_catalog.pg_auth_members m
                      JOIN pg_catalog.pg_roles b ON (m.roleid = b.oid)
             WHERE m.member = r.oid) as memberof
        , pg_catalog.shobj_description(r.oid, 'pg_authid') AS description
        , r.rolreplication
        , r.rolbypassrls
FROM pg_catalog.pg_roles r
WHERE r.rolname !~ '^pg_'
ORDER BY 1;

SELECT *,
  extract(epoch from now() - backend_start) AS conn_time,
  extract(epoch from now() - xact_start)    AS xact_time,
  extract(epoch from now() - query_start)   AS query_time,
  extract(epoch from now() - state_change)  AS state_time
FROM pg_stat_activity;

SELECT
  now() as time ,
  coalesce(backend_type, 'null') as metric,
  count(*) as value
FROM pg_stat_activity
GROUP BY coalesce(backend_type, 'null');

SELECT
  now() as time ,
  coalesce(state, 'null') as metric,
  count(*) as value
FROM pg_stat_activity
GROUP BY coalesce(state, 'null');

SELECT
  now() as time ,
  coalesce(wait_event, 'null') as metric,
  count(*) as value
FROM pg_stat_activity
GROUP BY coalesce(wait_event, 'null');

SELECT
  now() as time ,
  coalesce(client_addr::text, 'null') as metric,
  count(*) as value
FROM pg_stat_activity
GROUP BY coalesce(client_addr::text, 'null');

SELECT
  now() as time ,
  coalesce(usename, 'null') as metric,
  count(*) as value
FROM pg_stat_activity
GROUP BY coalesce(usename, 'null');

SELECT
  now() as time ,
  coalesce(application_name, 'null') as metric,
  count(*) as value
FROM pg_stat_activity
GROUP BY 2;

SELECT queryid::TEXT AS qid, d.datname, r.rolname, s.*
FROM monitor.pg_stat_statements s
LEFT JOIN pg_database d ON s.dbid = d.oid
     LEFT JOIN pg_roles r ON s.userid = r.oid ORDER BY rows DESC LIMIT 200;

panels.description:
Area represent time spent
color represent RT of this query

targets.rawSql:
SELECT queryid::TEXT AS query, sum(total_exec_time) AS time_spent, sum(calls) AS calls, 
       sum(total_exec_time) / sum(calls) AS rt 
FROM
(SELECT queryid, total_exec_time, calls FROM monitor.pg_stat_statements s ORDER BY rows DESC LIMIT 200) raw
WHERE calls > 0
GROUP BY 1 ORDER BY 2 DESC;

panels.title: Query (by Time Spent)

panels.description: These settings can only be applied when the server starts

targets.rawSql: SELECT now() AS time, name AS metric,setting AS value FROM pg_settings WHERE context = 'postmaster'

panels.title: Postmaster

panels.description: These settings cannot be changed directly; they reflect internally determined values. Some of them may be adjustable by rebuilding the server with different configuration options, or by changing options supplied to initdb.

targets.rawSql: SELECT now() AS time, name AS metric,setting AS value FROM pg_settings WHERE context = 'internal'

panels.title: Internal

panels.description: These settings that has non-default values

targets.rawSql: SELECT name,setting,source,context,pending_restart FROM pg_settings;

panels.title: Changed

panels.description: Info from pg_control_system

targets.rawSql: SELECT * FROM pg_control_init();

panels.title: Init Parameters

targets.rawSql: SELECT now() AS time, name AS metric,setting AS value FROM pg_settings WHERE name in ('archive_command', 'primary_conninfo')

panels.description: The pg_stat_replication view will contain one row per WAL sender process, showing statistics about replication to that sender's connected standby server. Only directly connected standbys are listed; no information is available about downstream standby servers.

value.title: PGSQL Instance for replication destination instance ${__data.fields.DST}

targets.rawSql:
SELECT application_name                                                 AS appname,
       usename,
       coalesce(abbrev(client_addr), 'localhost') || ':' || client_port AS address,
       pid,
       state,
       sync_state,
       sync_priority,
       backend_xmin::TEXT::BIGINT                                       AS backend_xmin,
       current.lsn - '0/0'                                              AS lsn,
       current.lsn - sent_lsn                                           AS sent_diff,
       current.lsn - write_lsn                                          AS write_diff,
       current.lsn - flush_lsn                                          AS flush_diff,
       current.lsn - replay_lsn                                         AS replay_diff,
       coalesce(extract(EPOCH FROM write_lag), 0)                       AS write_lag,
       coalesce(extract(EPOCH FROM flush_lag), 0)                       AS flush_lag,
       coalesce(extract(EPOCH FROM replay_lag), 0)                      AS replay_lag,
       extract(EPOCH FROM current_timestamp)                            AS "time",
       extract(EPOCH FROM backend_start)                                AS launch_time,
       extract(EPOCH FROM reply_time)                                   AS reply_time
FROM pg_stat_replication,
     (SELECT CASE WHEN pg_is_in_recovery() THEN pg_last_wal_replay_lsn() ELSE pg_current_wal_lsn() END AS lsn) current;

panels.title: Replication Stats

targets.rawSql:
SELECT *, 
CASE WHEN pg_is_in_recovery() THEN pg_last_wal_replay_lsn() ELSE pg_current_wal_lsn() END - restart_lsn AS retain 
FROM pg_replication_slots 
WHERE slot_type = 'physical';

SELECT *, 
CASE WHEN pg_is_in_recovery() THEN pg_last_wal_replay_lsn() ELSE pg_current_wal_lsn() END - restart_lsn AS retain 
FROM pg_replication_slots 
WHERE slot_type = 'logical';

panels.description: The pg_stat_wal_receiver view will contain only one row, showing statistics about the WAL receiver from that receiver's connected server.

targets.rawSql: SELECT * FROM pg_stat_wal_receiver;

panels.title: WAL Receiver (Replica Only)

panels.description: The pg_stat_wal_receiver view will contain only one row, showing statistics about the WAL receiver from that receiver's connected server.

targets.rawSql: SELECT * FROM pg_stat_subscription;

panels.title: Subscription

panels.description: Publication Information

targets.rawSql: SELECT * FROM pg_publication;

panels.title: Publication

panels.description: PostgreSQL server's main shared memory segment.

targets.rawSql: SELECT coalesce(name, 'Free') AS name, off AS offset, allocated_size AS size FROM monitor.pg_shmem();

panels.description: PostgreSQL server's main shared memory segment.

names: size Backend Client Host Name Buffer
size Fast Path Strong Relation Lock Data

targets.rawSql: SELECT now() AS time, coalesce(name, 'Free') AS name, allocated_size AS size FROM monitor.pg_shmem() ORDER BY 2 DESC;

panels.title: pg_shmem

panels.description: PostgreSQL server's main shared memory segment.

targets.rawSql: SELECT now() AS time, coalesce(name, 'Free') AS name, allocated_size AS size FROM monitor.pg_shmem() ORDER BY 2 DESC;

panels.title: pg_shmem

panels.description: PostgreSQL accesses certain on-disk information via SLRU (simple least-recently-used) caches. The pg_stat_slru view will contain one row for each tracked SLRU cache, showing statistics about access to cached pages.

targets.rawSql: SELECT * FROM pg_stat_slru;

panels.title: pg_stat_slru

targets.rawSql: SELECT * FROM pg_control_checkpoint();
SELECT * FROM pg_control_system();
SELECT * FROM pg_stat_bgwriter;
SELECT * FROM pg_stat_wal;
SELECT * FROM pg_control_recovery();
